body_html:
@mkolod Ah, thanks for researching this so thoroughly.

As a general principle, we prefer to build and statically link dependencies for all required features. This simplifies deployment in certain settings (e.g., distributed training) and helps with reproducibility.

The right thing to do is to create a new rule that underneath uses genrule to compile assembly with nasm. I'm unsure about whether we'd want to add nasm as a required build-time dependency, though.

Unassigning since it's not clear we want to make libjpeg-turbo default because of the nasm dependency. Making it optional seems reasonable, though.
